result.execSummary:
The defendant CODY J DENSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 118 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CODY J DENSON

records.addlTxt: Letter from CORE Treatment Services Incorporated dated 09/01/2022

2:05 PM Defendant CODY J DENSON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for CODY J DENSON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with jail, costs and DNA sample and will plea to count 2 with probation and conditions and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged and orders counts 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

Count 2

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 4 years.

Court makes statement to the defendant regarding early termination of probation if defendant is doing well.

CONDITIONS (count 1 & 2):

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended, which may include in-patient treatment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

+Court grants the defendant 118 days of sentence credit if revoked.

Court adjourned at 2:23 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Pretrial Status Report

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. On May 31, 2022 - Court converts to a signature bond if the defendant is in an in-patient treatment facility. The agent is to transport the defendant to the facility. If the defendant is no longer there for any reason, the agent is to transport the defendant back to the jail. On 07/26/2022 - Court amends bond to: Allow the defendant to stay at a TLP or a Sober Living Facility.

Motion to Modify Bond - Defendant is no longer in treatment. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Court questions Atty Kapelis regarding a drug test. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by ADA McElroy. Statement by Agent Katie Suwyn. Court will amend bond to: Allow the defendant to stay at a TLP or a Sober Living Facility. Court leaves the Return Date set for 09/12 at 10:30 AM on the calendar.

3:42 PM Defendant CODY J DENSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for CODY J DENSON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond modification to allow defendant to go to treatment. Statement by the Court - defendant has refused to sign the bond. Statement by ADA McElroy - requests the Agent transport to treatment. Court will modify the bond to a signature bond if the agent agrees to transport the defendant to treatment and back from treatment. Court will amend under that condition.

Court will set for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant CODY J DENSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for CODY J DENSON.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Defendant states he will be waiving the right to a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. Court notes defense has filed a motion to modify bond. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. ADA McElroy makes statement regarding bond. Court denies bond modification. Court notes if defendant's agent can submit something in writing that def is accepted in residential treatment, court will look at converting the bond. 

Court will set Return Date for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Court will set Arraignment May 31, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:13 AM.
Defendant's
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Michael Kapelis
Second appearance on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:39 AM Defendant CODY J DENSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the time limits on the preliminary and right to an attorney. Statement by defendant - requests to waive the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant. Court takes it as a time limit waiver. Court sets for Status of Counsel on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Court informs defendant that since he did not sign the bond, that if the bond is posted and complies with the conditions, the defendant will not be released. Statement by defendant - understands.

Court adjourned at 10:42 AM

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits.
